TopicTitle: What is the best way to keep cargo stable in a plane cargo bay

Articles.Content: I have been using the B9 pack to deliver some of my equipment to other continents on Kerbin. My plane does great for somethings but fails horribly at other things. Ever time I try move my small refuel truck over it ends up exploding inside of the craft. I would build a helo or vtol to carry some of my larger things but I cant make one that gets off the ground more less carry a 30 tanker. I have tried using cargo nets, docking via KAS, a docking port, a big docking port and all is does is fall apart. I had an easier time moving an orange tank in this than a little truck lmao

Crafts won't collide with themselves. Docking ports aren't what you want unless you use a bunch of quantum struts. Separate ships will collide so use KAS winches and cargo nets. You will probably need anywhere from 3 to 8 winches. Use the removable plugs and mount them on teh truck EVA.

I have three on it right now, undocked just tring to keep it from shifting, as soon as I hit 100 or so mps it just all goes wrong. Although I did make a pretty need dropship for bombs and such and was going to use it as a module trandport but I dont know of a way to delay chutes from opening after they are seperated from the plane but that is for another time.
